fullProgramDescription: The Mathematics for Teaching program is designed for students who wish to teach mathematics at the secondary level. The program provides a strong foundation in mathematics, as well as preparation for the teacher credentialing process.
shortProgramDescription: The Mathematics for Teaching B.S. at UCLA prepares students to teach secondary mathematics with a strong foundation in mathematical content and teaching methods.
classHighlights: The program requires a series of mathematics courses, including calculus, linear algebra, differential equations, and abstract algebra, to build a strong foundation in mathematical content.
Students also take courses in mathematics education, including methods for teaching mathematics and classroom management.
The program includes a range of mathematics electives, such as number theory, geometry, and probability and statistics, to provide a broad understanding of mathematical concepts.
Additional coursework includes preparation for the teacher credentialing process, with an emphasis on teaching methods and classroom practice.
learningOutcomes: Develop a deep understanding of mathematical concepts and principles.
Apply mathematical knowledge to teach secondary mathematics effectively.
Demonstrate an understanding of teaching methods and classroom management techniques.
Prepare for the teacher credentialing process.
additionalInformation: Students in this program must also apply for the teacher credentialing program through the UCLA Graduate School of Education & Information Studies.
